meanings.definition: A small, distinct culture within a larger society.
meanings.sent1: In the school library, the group of students who always sit together forms a unique microculture.
meanings.sent2: The microculture of the neighborhood can be seen in the way people decorate their houses.
meanings.sent3: The microculture of the office coffee drinkers includes a daily debate on the best brewing method.
meanings.sent4: The microculture of the gaming community is like a hidden world full of secrets and strategies.
meanings.sent5: The microculture of the knitting club is a colorful tapestry of creativity and friendship.

meanings.definition: The beliefs, behaviors, and customs of a specific group within a society.
meanings.sent1: The microculture of the book club revolves around lively discussions and shared love for literature.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the microculture of a team can lead to better collaboration and communication.
meanings.sent3: The microculture of the family dinner table involves sharing stories and passing down traditions.
meanings.sent4: The microculture of the music fans at the concert created an atmosphere of excitement and unity.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the microculture of a new city can reveal hidden gems and unique experiences.
